hints.label: thm-mean-field-lsi-main
hints.title: Exponential KL-Convergence in the Mean-Field Limit
hints.content:
6066: :label: thm-mean-field-lsi-main
6067: 
6068: Let $\rho_t$ be the solution to the mean-field McKean-Vlasov-Fokker-Planck PDE for the Euclidean Gas:
6069: 
6070: $$
6071: \frac{\partial \rho}{\partial t} = \mathcal{L}[\rho] = \mathcal{L}_{\text{kin}}[\rho] + \mathcal{L}_{\text{jump}}[\rho]
6072: 
6073: $$
6074: 
6075: where:
6076: - $\mathcal{L}_{\text{kin}}$ is the kinetic operator (Langevin dynamics)
6077: - $\mathcal{L}_{\text{jump}}$ is the mean-field jump operator (killing + revival)
6078: 
6079: Let $\rho_\infty$ be the unique Quasi-Stationary Distribution (QSD) satisfying the regularity properties R1-R6 established in Stage 0.5.
6080: 
6081: **Assume** the **Kinetic Dominance Condition** holds:
6082: 
6083: $$
6084: \delta := \lambda_{\text{LSI}} \sigma^2 - 2\lambda_{\text{LSI}}C_{\text{Fisher}}^{\text{coup}} - C_{\text{KL}}^{\text{coup}} - A_{\text{jump}} > 0
6085: 
6086: $$
6087: 
6088: where:
6089: - $\lambda_{\text{LSI}}$ is the Log-Sobolev constant of the QSD (Stage 2, Section 1.2)
6090: - $\sigma$ is the diffusion strength
6091: - $C_{\text{Fisher}}^{\text{coup}}$ is the coupling Fisher information bound (Stage 2, Section 1.3)
6092: - $C_{\text{KL}}^{\text{coup}}$ is the coupling KL bound (Stage 2, Section 1.3)
6093: - $A_{\text{jump}}$ is the jump operator expansion coefficient (Stage 2, Section 1.4)
6094: 
6095: **Then** for any initial density $\rho_0$ with finite relative entropy $D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_0 \| \rho_\infty) < \infty$, the solution converges exponentially to the QSD:
6096: 
6097: $$
6098: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_t \| \rho_\infty) \le e^{-\delta t} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_0 \| \rho_\infty) + \frac{C_{\text{offset}}}{\delta} (1 - e^{-\delta t})
6099: 
6100: $$
6101: 
6102: where the offset constant is:
6103: 
6104: $$
6105: C_{\text{offset}} := \frac{\sigma^2}{2} C_{\text{LSI}} + C_0^{\text{coup}} + B_{\text{jump}}
6106: 
6107: $$
6108: 
6109: with:
6110: - $C_{\text{LSI}}$ from the LSI remainder (Stage 2, Lemma `lem-fisher-bound`)
6111: - $C_0^{\text{coup}}$ from the coupling constant bound (Stage 2, Section 3.3)
6112: - $B_{\text{jump}}$ from the jump operator bound (Stage 2, Section 4.4)
6113: 
6114: **Asymptotic behavior**: As $t \to \infty$,
6115: 
6116: $$
6117: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_t \| \rho_\infty) \to \frac{C_{\text{offset}}}{\delta}
6118: 
6119: $$
6120: 
6121: **Important**: The system converges exponentially to a **residual neighborhood** of the QSD with radius $C_{\text{offset}}/\delta$ in KL-divergence. For true convergence to the QSD (zero residual), $C_{\text{offset}}$ must vanish, which occurs in local basins near equilibrium where higher-order remainder terms become negligible.
6122: 
6123: **Convergence rate**: The effective rate is $\alpha_{\text{net}} = \delta$, with explicit formula:
6124: 
6125: $$
6126: \alpha_{\text{net}} = \lambda_{\text{LSI}} \sigma^2 - 2\lambda_{\text{LSI}}C_{\text{Fisher}}^{\text{coup}} - C_{\text{KL}}^{\text{coup}} - A_{\text{jump}}
6127: 
6128: $$
